params.name: server-url
params.description: The URL of the running boskos server

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of resource to request. Resource types are specified in the resource
ConfigMap provided to the Boskos server.

params.name: owner-name
params.description: A string that identifies the owner of the leased resource to request.

taskSpec.description:
Acquire a project using Boskos.

The boskos-acquire Task will request a resource of the specified type from the
server-url. If successful, it will start a pod that will run the boskosctl heartbeat
command. When you are done with the resource, release it with boskos-release.

steps.name: create-heartbeat-pod-yaml
steps.script:
FULL_RESOURCE_OUTPUT=$(cat /workspace/full-resource-output.json)
LEASED_RESOURCE=$(cat /tekton/results/leased-resource)
cat <<EOF | kubectl apply -f -
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: boskos-heartbeat-$LEASED_RESOURCE
spec:
  nodeSelector:
    kubernetes.io/arch: amd64
  containers:
  - name: heartbeat
    image: gcr.io/k8s-staging-boskos/boskosctl@sha256:a7fc984732c5dd0b4e0fe0a92e2730fa4b6bddecd0f6f6c7c6b5501abe4ab105
    args:
    - heartbeat
    - --server-url=http://boskos.apps.svc
    - --owner-name=build-package-pingcap-tidb-darwin-g9k4f
    - --resource=$FULL_RESOURCE_OUTPUT
    - --period=5m
EOF

results.name: leased-resource
results.description: The name of the leased resource

params.name: version
params.description: the version to releasing.

params.name: profile
params.description: supports: 'release' or 'debug'.

steps.name: generate-build-script
steps.script:
git clone --depth=1 --branch=main https://github.com/PingCAP-QE/artifacts.git /workspace/artifacts

git_ref="master"
git_sha="be62f754fb4182a544b52b2f58a5f867136e7695"
if [ "$git_sha" == "$git_ref" ]; then
  git_sha=""
fi

out_script="/workspace/build-package-artifacts.sh"
/workspace/artifacts/packages/scripts/gen-package-artifacts-with-config.sh \
  tidb \
  darwin \
  arm64 \
  v7.6.0-alpha-391-gbe62f754fb \
  release \
  $git_ref \
  "$git_sha" \
  /workspace/artifacts/packages/packages.yaml.tmpl \
  "$out_script"

if [ -f "$out_script" ]; then
  cat "$out_script"
fi

steps.name: prepare-remote-builder
steps.script:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -exo pipefail

if [ "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_BOUND}" != "true" ] ; then
  exit 0
fi

if [ "darwin" != "darwin" ]; then
  exit 0
fi


if [ ! -f "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_PATH}/hosts.yaml" ]; then
  echo "No ~/.ssh/hosts.yaml found, we need it to get the address and other insecret configurations."
  exit 1
fi

which yq || (echo "No yq tool found, I need it!"; exit 1)
mkdir -p "$REMOTE_BUILDER_INFO_DIR"

######### checks and sets #########
yq '.["darwin-arm64-1"].host'   "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_PATH}/hosts.yaml" > "$REMOTE_BUILDER_INFO_DIR/ssh_host"
yq '.["darwin-arm64-1"].config.workspace_dir'   "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_PATH}/hosts.yaml" > "$REMOTE_BUILDER_INFO_DIR/ssh_workspace"
# TODO: do more pre-check or pre-set.

steps.name: build
steps.script:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -exo pipefail

script="/workspace/build-package-artifacts.sh"
if [ ! -f "$script" ]; then
  echo "No build script, skip build."
  exit 0
fi

##### Build mac targets in tekton task (k8s pod) ####
# 1. Set ssh credentials
if [ "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_BOUND}" != "true" ] ; then
  echo "‚ùå: No ssh credential volume mounted, it's required!"
  exit 1
fi
cp -R "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_PATH}" ~/.ssh
chmod 700 ~/.ssh
chmod -R 400 ~/.ssh/*
username=$(cat ~/.ssh/username)
host=$(cat "$REMOTE_BUILDER_INFO_DIR/ssh_host")
ssh-keyscan -H $host >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
workspace_base_dir=$(cat "$REMOTE_BUILDER_INFO_DIR/ssh_workspace")

# 2. login to the remote builder with ssh and then execute the shell.
# TODO: we need some pre-check scripts: such as get git version...

# 2.1 create a randon workspace dir in the remote host:
remote_workspace_dir="${workspace_base_dir}/$(uuidgen)"
ssh ${username}@${host} "mkdir -p '$remote_workspace_dir'"

# 2.2 copy the build shell to the remote host by ssh.
scp ""$script"" ${username}@${host}:"$remote_workspace_dir/"

# 2.3 copy source codes from workspace `source` to the remote host by ssh.
scp -r $(workspaces.source.path) ${username}@${host}:"$remote_workspace_dir/"
remote_workspace_source_path="$remote_workspace_dir/$(basename $(workspaces.source.path))"

# 2.4 run the shell on the mac host by ssh.
# 2.4.1 optional get go builder in PATH env var, got the go version(x.y) from the current container with `go version`.
go_bin_path=""
if go version; then
  go_bin_path="/usr/local/$(go version | cut -d ' ' -f 3 | cut -d '.' -f -2)/bin"
fi

# run remote build
ssh $username@$host -t  "bash -lc '
  PATH=${go_bin_path}:\$PATH;
  cd "$remote_workspace_source_path";
  ${remote_workspace_dir}/build-package-artifacts.sh -b -a -w build
'"

# 2.5 copy the artifacts from the mac hosts to the workspace `source`, we need delivery them internal firstly.
scp -r ${username}@${host}:"$remote_workspace_source_path/build" ./

# 3. clean the workspace dir(it will be a random name) on the ssh mac host.
ssh ${username}@${host} "rm -rf '$remote_workspace_dir'"

steps.name: publish
steps.script:
script="/workspace/build-package-artifacts.sh"
if [ ! -f "$script" ]; then
  echo "No build script, skip build."
  exit 0
fi

oras version
"$script" -p -w "build"

workspaces.name: ssh-directory
workspaces.description: ssh credential for remote building on mac.

params.name: url
params.description: Repository URL to clone from.

params.name: revision
params.description: Revision to checkout. (branch, tag, sha, ref, etc...)

params.name: refspec
params.description: Refspec to fetch before checking out revision.

params.name: submodules
params.description: Initialize and fetch git submodules.

params.name: depth
params.description: Perform a shallow clone, fetching only the most recent N commits.

params.name: sslVerify
params.description: Set the `http.sslVerify` global git config. Setting this to `false` is not advised unless you are sure that you trust your git remote.

params.name: crtFileName
params.description: file name of mounted crt using ssl-ca-directory workspace. default value is ca-bundle.crt.

params.name: subdirectory
params.description: Subdirectory inside the `output` Workspace to clone the repo into.

params.name: sparseCheckoutDirectories
params.description: Define the directory patterns to match or exclude when performing a sparse checkout.

params.name: deleteExisting
params.description: Clean out the contents of the destination directory if it already exists before cloning.

params.name: httpProxy
params.description: HTTP proxy server for non-SSL requests.

params.name: httpsProxy
params.description: HTTPS proxy server for SSL requests.

params.name: noProxy
params.description: Opt out of proxying HTTP/HTTPS requests.

params.name: verbose
params.description: Log the commands that are executed during `git-clone`'s operation.

params.name: gitInitImage
params.description: The image providing the git-init binary that this Task runs.

params.name: userHome
params.description:
Absolute path to the user's home directory. Set this explicitly if you are running the image as a non-root user or have overridden
the gitInitImage param with an image containing custom user configuration.

taskSpec.description:
These Tasks are Git tasks to work with repositories used by other tasks in your Pipeline.
The git-clone Task will clone a repo from the provided url into the output Workspace. By default the repo will be cloned into the root of your Workspace. You can clone into a subdirectory by setting this Task's subdirectory param. This Task also supports sparse checkouts. To perform a sparse checkout, pass a list of comma separated directory patterns to this Task's sparseCheckoutDirectories param.

steps.name: clone
steps.script:
#!/usr/bin/env sh
set -eu

if [ "${PARAM_VERBOSE}" = "true" ] ; then
  set -x
fi

if [ "${WORKSPACE_BASIC_AUTH_DIRECTORY_BOUND}" = "true" ] ; then
  cp "${WORKSPACE_BASIC_AUTH_DIRECTORY_PATH}/.git-credentials" "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.git-credentials"
  cp "${WORKSPACE_BASIC_AUTH_DIRECTORY_PATH}/.gitconfig" "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.gitconfig"
  chmod 400 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.git-credentials"
  chmod 400 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.gitconfig"
fi

if [ "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_BOUND}" = "true" ] ; then
  cp -R "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_PATH}" "${PARAM_USER_HOME}"/.ssh
  chmod 700 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}"/.ssh
  chmod -R 400 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}"/.ssh/*
fi

if [ "${WORKSPACE_SSL_CA_DIRECTORY_BOUND}" = "true" ] ; then
   export GIT_SSL_CAPATH="${WORKSPACE_SSL_CA_DIRECTORY_PATH}"
   if [ "${PARAM_CRT_FILENAME}" != "" ] ; then
      export GIT_SSL_CAINFO="${WORKSPACE_SSL_CA_DIRECTORY_PATH}/${PARAM_CRT_FILENAME}"
   fi
fi
CHECKOUT_DIR="${WORKSPACE_OUTPUT_PATH}/${PARAM_SUBDIRECTORY}"

cleandir() {
  # Delete any existing contents of the repo directory if it exists.
  #
  # We don't just "rm -rf ${CHECKOUT_DIR}" because ${CHECKOUT_DIR} might be "/"
  # or the root of a mounted volume.
  if [ -d "${CHECKOUT_DIR}" ] ; then
    # Delete non-hidden files and directories
    rm -rf "${CHECKOUT_DIR:?}"/*
    # Delete files and directories starting with . but excluding ..
    rm -rf "${CHECKOUT_DIR}"/.[!.]*
    # Delete files and directories starting with .. plus any other character
    rm -rf "${CHECKOUT_DIR}"/..?*
  fi
}

if [ "${PARAM_DELETE_EXISTING}" = "true" ] ; then
  cleandir || true
fi

test -z "${PARAM_HTTP_PROXY}" || export HTTP_PROXY="${PARAM_HTTP_PROXY}"
test -z "${PARAM_HTTPS_PROXY}" || export HTTPS_PROXY="${PARAM_HTTPS_PROXY}"
test -z "${PARAM_NO_PROXY}" || export NO_PROXY="${PARAM_NO_PROXY}"

git config --global --add safe.directory "${WORKSPACE_OUTPUT_PATH}"
/ko-app/git-init \
  -url="${PARAM_URL}" \
  -revision="${PARAM_REVISION}" \
  -refspec="${PARAM_REFSPEC}" \
  -path="${CHECKOUT_DIR}" \
  -sslVerify="${PARAM_SSL_VERIFY}" \
  -submodules="${PARAM_SUBMODULES}" \
  -depth="${PARAM_DEPTH}" \
  -sparseCheckoutDirectories="${PARAM_SPARSE_CHECKOUT_DIRECTORIES}"
cd "${CHECKOUT_DIR}"
RESULT_SHA="$(git rev-parse HEAD)"
EXIT_CODE="$?"
if [ "${EXIT_CODE}" != 0 ] ; then
  exit "${EXIT_CODE}"
fi
RESULT_COMMITTER_DATE="$(git log -1 --pretty=%ct)"
printf "%s" "${RESULT_COMMITTER_DATE}" > "/tekton/results/committer-date"
printf "%s" "${RESULT_SHA}" > "/tekton/results/commit"
printf "%s" "${PARAM_URL}" > "/tekton/results/url"

workspaces.name: output
workspaces.description: The git repo will be cloned onto the volume backing this Workspace.

workspaces.name: ssh-directory
workspaces.description:
A .ssh directory with private key, known_hosts, config, etc. Copied to
the user's home before git commands are executed. Used to authenticate
with the git remote when performing the clone. Binding a Secret to this
Workspace is strongly recommended over other volume types.

workspaces.name: basic-auth
workspaces.description:
A Workspace containing a .gitconfig and .git-credentials file. These
will be copied to the user's home before any git commands are run. Any
other files in this Workspace are ignored. It is strongly recommended
to use ssh-directory over basic-auth whenever possible and to bind a
Secret to this Workspace over other volume types.

workspaces.name: ssl-ca-directory
workspaces.description:
A workspace containing CA certificates, this will be used by Git to
verify the peer with when fetching or pushing over HTTPS.

results.name: commit
results.description: The precise commit SHA that was fetched by this Task.

results.name: url
results.description: The precise URL that was fetched by this Task.

results.name: committer-date
results.description: The epoch timestamp of the commit that was fetched by this Task.

results.name: version
results.description: The release version of the git repo

params.name: server-url
params.description: The URL of the running boskos server

params.name: leased-resource
params.description: A string that identifies the leased resource to release.

params.name: owner-name
params.description: A string that identifies the owner of the leased resource to request.

taskSpec.description:
Release a project acquired using Boskos.

The boskos-release Task will release the specified resource from the boskos instance
at server-url. It also assumes the resource was obtained via boskos-acquire and so
terminates the heartbeat pod that was created by that Task to keep the resource obtained.
It will mark the resource as dirty so that the boskos Janitor will clean it (by deleting
any state created).

results.name: version
results.description: The release version of the git repo

params.name: binary-builder-iamge
params.description: The image used to build binaries.

workspaces.description: The workspace where the git repo will be cloned.
